item.title: Texas Sues Meta Over Facebook's Facial-Recognition Practices
item.description: State says the social-media giant violated privacy protections in lawsuit, seeking civil penalties that a person familiar with the matter says range in the hundreds of billions of dollars.

item.title: DoorDash to Bump Up Its Fees on Slow McDonald's Restaurants
item.description: Orders that aren’t filled on time will incur higher commission charges starting next year, as the food-delivery app tries to tackle profit obstacles.

item.title: OpenSea's NFT Free-for-All
item.description: Enthusiasts love the freewheeling atmosphere on the marketplace, which calls itself “an eBay for crypto goods.” But limited oversight also means the site is awash in unauthorized items; securing compensation after a scam can be tough.

item.title: Discover Is Bringing a Payment Option Popular in Asia to the U.S.
item.description: The card company is partnering with fintech firm Buy It Mobility Networks, whose technology allows consumers to pay directly from their checking accounts using merchants’ apps.

item.title: Ukraine's Armed Drones Could Offset Some of Russia's Military Advantage
item.description: Turkish-made drones, known as Bayraktar TB2s, could offer Ukraine a tool that could offset some of Russia’s enormous military advantage.

item.title: The Technology That's Helping Companies Thrive Amid the Supply-Chain Chaos
item.description: Startups are developing better ways to move products around, from snapping up goods stranded by logistics snafus to automating warehouse work.

item.title: BlockFi to Pay Record Penalty to Settle SEC Probe of Crypto Lending
item.description: A cryptocurrency company that allowed nearly 600,000 users to earn interest by lending their holdings to other traders will pay $100 million to settle claims that its product violated investor-protection laws.

item.title: Musk Says Florida Site Could Handle Starship Tests
item.description: SpaceX signaled it might conduct testing from the Kennedy Space Center complex if the FAA pursues an additional environmental review of a company facility in Texas.

item.title: Jeff Lawson Built Twilio. Mentors Helped Him Make It Better.
item.description: Advisers inspired the 44-year-old billionaire to offer more support to his employees and make the cloud-communications company more diverse.

item.title: SEC Proposes Cyber Rules for Investment Funds and Advisers
item.description: Under the draft proposals, thousands of financial firms would be required to report ‘significant events,’ including data breaches, within 48 hours.

item.title: Cisco Made $20 Billion-Plus Takeover Offer for Splunk
item.description: Cisco Systems Inc. has made a takeover offer worth more than $20 billion for software maker Splunk Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: California Sues Tesla, Alleging Racial Bias and Abuse
item.description: A California regulatory agency said it has filed a lawsuit against Tesla, alleging racial discrimination and harassment at the electric-vehicle maker.

item.title: How Feds Tracked Down Billions in Stolen Bitcoin
item.description: The U.S. government said a couple acted to break up crypto transactions to make them harder to track.

item.title: Forget the Office---Salesforce Is Making a Wellness Retreat for Workers
item.description: Salesforce.com is creating a corporate culture epicenter at a California retreat where thousands of workers will connect in person and get training.

item.title: SpaceX's Elon Musk Expects Starship to Deliver Launches at Lower Costs
item.description: Starship should be able to reach orbits for less than $10 million a flight within two to three years, Elon Musk said during a presentation at SpaceX’s southern Texas facility, where the company plans to launch the spacecraft.
